summary: The Service Dogs Assisting Veterans Act of 2025 (S.1441) establishes a pilot program within the Department of Veterans Affairs to award grants to nonprofit entities. These grants will fund programs providing service dogs to eligible veterans with disabilities, including those with PTSD, mobility issues, and visual impairments. The bill details application requirements, grant amounts, permissible uses of funds, veteran notifications, veterinary insurance provision, oversight, and a definition of 'eligible veteran' and 'service dog.' It authorizes $10 million annually for five years to support the program.
